description:
Command line tools use [GRIB API](https://software.ecmwf.int/wiki/display/GRIB/Home) for interactive and batch processing of GRIB data. These tools provide a ready and tested solution for many situations and their use will speed up your work by obviating the need for new code. Use with an enhanced terminal such as [ConEmu](https://chocolatey.org/packages/ConEmu) or [Cmder](https://chocolatey.org/packages/Cmder) is recommended.

This distribution includes:
* [grib\_compare](https://software.ecmwf.int/wiki/display/GRIB/grib\_compare)
* [grib\_copy](https://software.ecmwf.int/wiki/display/GRIB/grib\_copy)
* [grib\_dump](https://software.ecmwf.int/wiki/display/GRIB/grib\_dump)
* [grib\_filter](https://software.ecmwf.int/wiki/display/GRIB/grib\_filter)
* [grib\_get](https://software.ecmwf.int/wiki/display/GRIB/grib\_get)
* [grib\_get\_data](https://software.ecmwf.int/wiki/display/GRIB/grib\_get\_data)
* [grib\_ls](https://software.ecmwf.int/wiki/display/GRIB/grib\_ls)
* [grib\_set](https://software.ecmwf.int/wiki/display/GRIB/grib\_set)
summary: Command line tools for interactive and batch processing of GRIB 1 and 2 data.
author: European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts (ECMWF)
